data.title: Heart of grid
data.statement:
You get a grid whose height and width are equal to [[length]] and is filled with integers. Your goal is to check if the number in the <<heart>> of the grid is equal to the <<largest>> number in the frame of the grid. If this is true output <<true>>, if not output <<false>>.

For example:
[[length]]: 5

`  4  10  -6   99   1
 72   8  -3   41  23 
 -4  31   5  -12  55
-93   5   8   82  68
 -9  29   2  -53  40`
The numbers in the frame (the numbers on the outside of the grid) are:
4, 10, -6, 99, 1, 23, 55, 68, 40, -53, 2, 29, -9, -93, -4, 72

The heart of the grid is: <<5>>
The largest number in the frame of the grid is: <<99>>
<<5>> is not equal to <<99>> so the output is: <<false>>
data.stubGenerator:
read length:int
loop length loopline length x:int
write true/false
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> an integer [[length]]
<<Next [[length]] lines:>> [[length]] integers (For example, If [[length]] == 3 then you get 3 integers each iteration).

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

You get a grid whose height and width are equal to length and is filled with integers. Your goal is to check if the number in the heart of the grid is equal to the largest number in the frame of the grid. If this is true output true, if not output false.

For example:
length: 5

  4  10  -6   99   1
 72   8  -3   41  23 
 -4  31   5  -12  55
-93   5   8   82  68
 -9  29   2  -53  40

The numbers in the frame (the numbers on the outside of the grid) are:
4, 10, -6, 99, 1, 23, 55, 68, 40, -53, 2, 29, -9, -93, -4, 72

The heart of the grid is: 5
The largest number in the frame of the grid is: 99
5 is not equal to 99 so the output is: false
Input
Line 1: an integer length
Next length lines: length integers (For example, If length == 3 then you get 3 integers each iteration).
Output
true or false according to the statement
Constraints
10 > length > 2
length is odd
Example
Input
3
4 0 6
7 8 -3
-4 3 5
Output
false
